title: Karl Stefanovic's This Time Next Year is ABSENT from Channel Nine's 2020 lineup
text:
Channel Nine announced its 2020 lineup including ratings winners like Married At First Sight and The Block on Wednesday.

But noticeably absent from the schedule is Karl Stefanovic's show This Time Next Year, which wrapped up its second season in September.

The show lost viewers throughout its second season before reaching an all-time low of just 395,000 viewers last month.

Won't see you This Time Next Year! Karl Stefanovic's (pictured) show was ABSENT from Channel Nine's 2020 lineup on Wednesday

This Time Next Year premiered to a modest 686,000 viewers in August and dropped to just 437,000 by the finale episode at the end of September.

The penultimate episode marked a low point for the series and a loss of around 300,000 viewers since the premiere.

When compared to the first season in 2017, the show premiered to almost 1.3 million viewers and maintained 800,000 throughout most of the episodes.

Rough patch: The show lost viewers throughout its second season before reaching an all-time low of just 395,000 viewers last month

On Wednesday, Channel Nine released its 2020 line up, promising 'all of Australia's biggest shows' like Married At First Sight, Love Island Australia and The Block.

This Time Next Year was not mentioned in the jam-packed announcement.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel Nine for comment.

Potential explanation: The show takes two years to film, one year to film the participants' pledges and another year to check in on whether they've achieved there goals

However, there may be another explanation for This Time Next Year's absence from the announcement.

The show takes two years to film, one year to film the participants' pledges and another year to check in on whether they've achieved there goals.

Noticeably, there was previously a two year gap between the first season in 2017 and the second season in 2019.

Furthermore, on Wednesday night Karl attended the Channel Nine Upfront event at Sydney's Fox Studios, suggesting his position was safe.
description: Channel Nine announced its 2020 lineup including ratings winners like Married At First Sight and The Block on Wednesday.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
